text: Anatoly Yakovlevich Lein (; March 28, 1931 â€“ March 1, 2018) was a Soviet-born American chess Grandmaster. He was born in Leningrad. In 1976 Lein emigrated to the United States, finishing equal first with Leonid Shamkovich in the U.S. Open, and equal first with Bernard Zuckerman in the World Open chess tournament that year. He also played on the U.S. team in the 1978 Chess Olympiad. In 2005 he was inducted into the World Chess Hall of Fame in Miami. Lein died on March 1, 2018 in Beachwood, Ohio at the age of 86.Anatoly Lein ==References== Category:1931 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Soviet chess players Category:American chess players Category:Chess grandmasters Category:Sportspeople from Ohio
